result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Reigel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact w/GRP, her family or her residence
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 w/o approval of agent, with the exception of his children

Counseling deemed necessary
  DNA sample must be provided within 30 days
Register on sex offender registry

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Jury trial - 12 person at 01-28-2016 08:30 am

10:30 Defendant Matthew A Reigel in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

10:00 Defendant Matthew A Reigel in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Officer Jason Foemmel is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to his employment with Marshfield Police Dept.  He is the Marshfield High School Liason Officer.  Testifies to knowledge of GRP and occurance on 03/31/15 regarding sexual assault.  Testifies to observing interview of GRP.  GRP indicated that she was brought back to a residence and was sexually assaulted by Matthew Reigel.  Testifies to contact with Matthew Reigel regarding the incident.  Identifies Reigel in the courtroom.  Testifies to GRPs age at the time of the incident.

Atty Slattery cross examines the witness.  Testifies to how he obtained the victims date of birth.  Explains the different dates in the complaint.  Testifies to how the address of the incident was confirmed.  

Redirect by Atty Zell.  Clarifies the dates of occurance.  Testifies to how the address was determined.  

Probable cause is found.  Matter is bound over for Arraignment.  Atty Slattery addresses a possible conflict of interest with John Hoefs being involved due to past representation.  Matter is set for Arraignment on a later date.  Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 09-15-2015 10:00 am
(Defendant)
